QuestionJSON.Question: Current is creating a program that simulates an ecosystem. They need to program a piece of code that sorts species based on their population size from smallest to largest. Current tries different algorithms, but doesn't know which to use. Which algorithm would be the most appropriate for this task?
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Any of these would be appropriate
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The Bubble Sort algorithm can be used to sort an array in increasing order. Binary search is use to search ro4 a value in an array. Catgorization can sort elements into categories but does not put them in order.
